alert.note: Alert for Eastern Monmouth; Middlesex; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 1:58PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Monmouth and southeastern Middlesex Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 158 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Morganville, or 11 miles south of Perth Amboy, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Middletown, Old Bridge, East Brunswick, Marlboro, Manalapan, Tinton Falls, Holmdel, Red Bank, Matawan, Jamesburg, Brownville, East Freehold, Robertsville, West Freehold, Adelphia, Yorketown, Whittingham, Navesink, Lincroft and Morganville. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 9. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 105 and 120. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
